item.title: Cloud IT Online Backup For Business
item.description: Cloud backups are gaining popularity for personal use, safeguarding against data loss. But what about businesses? Are cloud-based backup services beneficial for them too? Independent professionals might find consumer-oriented services like Apple’s iCloud sufficient. However, businesses, especially those with multiple employees and locations, often benefit from business-specific cloud services, particularly when part of a managed IT solution. Two primary approaches exist for cloud-based file backup. One treats the cloud as a separate repository for copies of essential business files.

item.title: Your 50 Mbps WAN Bandwidth Options
item.description: By: John Shepler The need for 50 Mbps bandwidth has increased due to businesses needing to use cloud services, access remote data centers, transfer large data files, run e-commerce platforms, send high-resolution images, and distribute video content. There are various ways to get 50 Mbps bandwidth connectivity, each with its own benefits and drawbacks. DS3 & T3 DS3, or T3, is a traditional telecom service designed for transmitting many calls simultaneously between switching centers.
